# Task

You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is a Julia function that performs this task using the DataFrames package:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates # make sure you have these packages installed by running `] add DataFrames Dates` in your REPL

function audi_filter(df_cars::DataFrame)
    df = filter(row -> row.manufacturer == "audi" && (row.model == "a4" || row.model == "a4 quattro"), df_cars)
    df[:audi_a4_type] .= true  # create a new column with all values as true
    return df
end
```

You can call the function using:

```julia
df_result = audi_filter(df_cars)
```

This code will filter out rows in `df_cars` that have "audi" as manufacturer and either "a4" or "a4 quattro" as model, then it adds a new column `:audi_a4_type` with all entries as true. The resulting DataFrame is returned.
